segment.source: Assign applications using roles in MDT (Windows 10)
segment.target: Assign applications using roles in MDT (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic will show you how to add applications to a role in the MDT database and then assign that role to a computer.
segment.target: This topic will show you how to add applications to a role in the MDT database and then assign that role to a computer.

segment.source: Assign applications using roles in MDT
segment.target: Assign applications using roles in MDT

segment.source: This topic will show you how to add applications to a role in the MDT database and then assign that role to a computer.
segment.target: This topic will show you how to add applications to a role in the MDT database and then assign that role to a computer.

segment.source: For the purposes of this topic, the application we are adding is Adobe Reader XI.
segment.target: For the purposes of this topic, the application we are adding is Adobe Reader XI.

segment.source: In addition to using computer-specific entries in the database, you can use roles in MDT to group settings together.
segment.target: In addition to using computer-specific entries in the database, you can use roles in MDT to group settings together.

segment.source: Create and assign a role entry in the database
segment.target: Create and assign a role entry in the database

segment.source: On MDT01, using Deployment Workbench, in the MDT Production deployment share, expand Advanced Configuration and then expand Database.
segment.target: On MDT01, using Deployment Workbench, in the MDT Production deployment share, expand Advanced Configuration and then expand Database.

segment.source: In the Database node, right-click Role, select New, and create a role entry with the following settings:
segment.target: In the Database node, right-click Role, select New, and create a role entry with the following settings:

segment.source: Role name: Standard PC
segment.target: Role name: Standard PC

segment.source: Applications / Lite Touch Applications:
segment.target: Applications / Lite Touch Applications:

segment.source: Install - Adobe Reader XI - x86
segment.target: Install - Adobe Reader XI - x86

segment.source: figure 12
segment.target: figure 12

segment.source: Figure 12.
segment.target: Figure 12.

segment.source: The Standard PC role with the application added
segment.target: The Standard PC role with the application added

segment.source: Associate the role with a computer in the database
segment.target: Associate the role with a computer in the database

segment.source: After creating the role, you can associate it with one or more computer entries.
segment.target: After creating the role, you can associate it with one or more computer entries.

segment.source: Using Deployment Workbench, expand MDT Production, expand Advanced Configuration, expand Database, and select Computers.
segment.target: Using Deployment Workbench, expand MDT Production, expand Advanced Configuration, expand Database, and select Computers.

segment.source: In the Computers node, double-click the PC00075 entry, and add the following setting:
segment.target: In the Computers node, double-click the PC00075 entry, and add the following setting:

segment.source: Roles: Standard PC
segment.target: Roles: Standard PC

segment.source: figure 13
segment.target: figure 13

segment.source: Figure 13.
segment.target: Figure 13.

segment.source: The Standard PC role added to PC00075 (having ID 1 in the database).
segment.target: The Standard PC role added to PC00075 (having ID 1 in the database).

segment.source: Verify database access in the MDT simulation environment
segment.target: Verify database access in the MDT simulation environment

segment.source: When the database is populated, you can use the MDT simulation environment to simulate a deployment.
segment.target: When the database is populated, you can use the MDT simulation environment to simulate a deployment.

segment.source: The applications are not installed, but you can see which applications would be installed if you did a full deployment of the computer.
segment.target: The applications are not installed, but you can see which applications would be installed if you did a full deployment of the computer.

segment.source: On PC0001, log on as CONTOSOMDTBA.
segment.target: On PC0001, log on as CONTOSOMDTBA.

segment.source: Modify the C:MDTCustomSettings.ini file to look like the following:
segment.target: Modify the C:MDTCustomSettings.ini file to look like the following:

segment.target: Using an elevated Windows PowerShell prompt (run as Administrator), run the following commands.
